message:
Crises such as contested sovereignty, lack of basic necessities like broadband, and the crisis of missing and murdered Indigenous women. 

I will tackle each of these issues by partnering with Native communities and using my platform in Congress to pass real solutions. (3/3)
name: Alyse Galvin

message:
Today is a day of reflection. 

Tomorrow - and every day after - is for action.

As a Representative, I will work to put an end to the crises that have been uniquely harming Native communities for too long and lift up Indigenous voices. (2/3)
name: Alyse Galvin

message:
Indigenous People’s Day has always been a day of reflection for me. 

I contemplate how Alaska’s Native communities have time and again organized to fight the inequities born from colonization. 

I ask myself what I can do to help eliminate those inequities. (1/3)
name: Alyse Galvin

message: The electoral college is the sum of US Reps+2(the number of senators for each state) this was a compromise to ensure small pop states still got a voice for pres. and to ensure 1 party domination of the presidency wouldn't occur. Each state decides how they vote for their EC votes
name: Joseph LeBlanc, Jr.

message: The two Houses were laid out as such in order to ensure the people were representedalong with the states themselves, since they were considered sovereign entities joined into a union, at the federal level.
name: Joseph LeBlanc, Jr.

message: The House of Representatives: based on population, 100% voted for every 2 yrs. The number of Reps were changed throughout early US history using the Jefferson method, until 1929 when the total was set at 435 and Reps were reappropriated accordingly after each census.
name: Joseph LeBlanc, Jr.

message:
Joe's American Govt. 101 free course:
The Senate: 2 senators per state to ensure equal rep. of each state at the federal level. 6 yr terms, where 1/3 of the Senate is voted for every 2 yrs. Originally voted by state govt until 1913's 17th Amend. which changed to pop vote.
